Author: phm87#7395
Content:
About aux pow, I made the calculation based on zpool numbers and I found 6% for sha256. But it depends on price and difficulty.
If we read the code, it seems that aux mining is literally as an free addition. Aux is checked always first whenever submit is made and height of submit is higher than any aux. So if a submit happens for BTC, we could find a block of all aux coins on sha256

Author: phm87#7395
Content: https://github.com/tpruvot/yiimp/blob/next/stratum/client_submit.cpp#L161

Author: phm87#7395
Content: On scrypt, I calculated 2.7% of additionnal profit with aux mining (with several aux coins)

Author: Ondalf#1318
Content: Also, small diff coins gets slowly up in the difficulty scale, if there are miners with various speeds as it can allocate only single miner to mine coin X. By default, yiimp refuses to push more than twice the nethash speed into coin, UNLESS it's alone in the algo

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: All n and k are supported already as long as k is bigger than n. However, to use large numbers of them u need to add more code as u need an equihsh solver defined for each value. I got around this by adding komodo_nk.h which can take any value and a recompile enables it. I've tested all the values hardcoded as well as 77/3

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: @dukeleto @jl777c

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Tromp solver is not working with ac_nk

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Never tested a pool

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I think it's useful for coins that like the idea of hard forking to another algo as soon as ASIC/FPGAs are on it

Author: Alright#0419
Content: it's a cat and mouse game at that point, but many coins are playing this exact game right now

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Also useful for chains that don't have value such as an oracles specific chain

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Also if you look at the code, I added a BEAM specific thing to the generatehash function, that is only active when using ac_nk... this *should* make BEAM miners and pools work with ac_nk but only for 150,5 values.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think it would also be possible to change that generate hash in some small way, to also fork each nk value from ASIC aswell, but not sure about that.,

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content:
Isnt the idea of having lots of miners/high hash rates to secure your blockchain ledger? If decentralisation is the reason you're changing algo, i dont think it is a valid point.
If your algorithm already has ASIC's on it that are widely available(such as equihash), surely this would be more secure, as well as more decentralised, than switching to another algorithm?
Once you switch to another algorithm, security is comprised by the first company to make an ASIC or FPGA code for it, as they will have access to a majority of the hash rate.
What are peoples thoughts on this?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: dont you know that "decentralization" means "any algo as long as i have hardware for it already" otherwise its "centralized"

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: plz dont let the facts get in the way!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as the facts are BTC is the most secure as every efficiency is put in play and it requires maybe a gigawatt of power to attack it, not to mention all the hardware.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all these coins that switch away from algos with ASIC so it is for GPU and then the fpga drinks their milkshake. it almost seems like a marketing effort of the fpga outfits

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: It is perplexing. I dont particularly understand it. Dont get me wrong, I like that you are creating an ability to chose what algorithm people want when creating an assetchain, I just dont understand algo hoping and the ideology of remaining decentralised through running away from ASIC's.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: For me, it was msotly looking for a way to secure and mine chains with out a block reward... When you have ASIC values, then the cahins can be stopepd dead for maybe even weeks at a time. Byt using some obsucre values and being able to easiy change it, we can rely on dpow alone to secure the chains.

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: What would the use case of such a chain be?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It was msotly for LABS. VerusHash 1.1 and any nk value gives us a pretty solid way to prevent nasty miners breaking the LABS cluster just for lolz

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Yeah thats fair I guess, low difficulty chains can get screwed for a long time by ASIC's

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: exaclty. Not that it matters, a determined person could still break it with massive amounts of AWS VPS's... but its not a bad as ASIC or as cheap.

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: I'd say that use case is fairly corner case though. Could you just not write in an auto difficulty scale up, say below a certain amount of hash, to stop that difficulty spike?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: people have been trying for years...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not much can gracefully handle a million times increase of hashrate, that then disappears

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: I was unaware, but not surprised somebody has already thought to find a solution for it aha

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: hybrid PoS/PoW can kind ifo handle it, but introduces more problems as you need more nodes to keep the chains moving.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Like you say though, these kinds of chains and not really going to be used for much in the real world outsude of LABS.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: until they are

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: I mean if a chain hasnt had much development in awhile, and are still being used, they could look at switching to a hybrid model

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in the world of millions of chains, i think almost all conceivable variations will exist

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: They do. But we could provide a solution to it

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: This is true., I guess if LABS is sucessful with it, people will use it. I was hoping to be able to steal Verus's merge mining stuff so LABS main chain could secure the 0BR Chains, butr so far that hasn't proved withing my skills to do.

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: The KMD chain assurance. Below x amount of hash, we recommend switching to a PoS/PoW hybrid and use NN's as stakers.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: This was my plan in LABS ues... but for notary ndoe to effectivly stake and notarize at the same time, is quite a hard problem to solve.

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: They wouldnt have to. You could give them a staking pubkey, to use on another node?

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: So a NN would have two pubkeys added in the hardfork

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: you can easily use 2 nodes. that is no problem. But running 2 of every node is not that easy.

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Of every node?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Most notary nodes would need a second server for this as they run bare metal machines with a single IP. I guess you can change ports n users n stuf but its hard to manage.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think I worked out how to make notaries be able to stake, but it required being able to load a second wallet.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: and the code change was too great...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: too many possible things to go wrong

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: I mean a staking node could be a cheap node, and we could just make it a requirement to do it?

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: If KMD saw it as a valuable thing to offer chains

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: wihout some solution like this, we end up with the situation now, where notaries who mine AC, are usually lower in counts... So competetive nodes either dont mine at all, or use a second node.

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: I imagine if there are a million assetchains, a shitload may end up with small amounts of hash, but still require dpow

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: But how to you enforce a notary OP to mine/stake ?  Maybe it becomes some election pledge who knows.

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: You could require it? Or offer a different reward for doing it. Two pubkeys, a notarising one, a staking one.

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Maybe KMD could offer chain assurance as part of the dpow fee

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: There is nothing to say a single notary doesnt require two nodes?

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Or wont require more than one in the future

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I messed around for litterally weeks on this problem lol... Tried hundreds of com,binations of hash algo, staking utxos and values... never really got anything to works quite right... Although I got VerusHash 1.1 chain taht can be kept moving with a difficulty over a billion using only 2000 coins and 2 CPU cores üòÇ

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Hovever the blokctimes were attrocious... block a bunch in a minute then stop for a while... All the time.

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Surely something like 97% PoS/3%PoW would continue with such high hashing amounts?

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: May as well just be PoS at that point maybe aha

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yep pretty much. I really depends on what you want to do. For LABS the issue is that if you use too much PoS% on the 0BR chains, people are losing out on staking rewards on the main chain, so its likely it will end up without enough staking utxos to keep it movning along. So my solution was to use 10-20%PoS so a very small value of coins would block enough to keep the chain moving along. But to do this you really need s CPU algo or make it so that only noaries can mine.  Which is still an option I may look at depending on how things trun out after launch and are tested in the real world.

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content:
It is a problem that will need to be addressed for assetchains. I think if KMD offered an official solution, it would be better for the community, rather than a 3rd party offer a solution.
Could you add a NN only staking mode. Where miners could mine PoW normally, and the chain can have dpow, with NNs only  PoS staking?

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: This would incentivise NN's getting another node by accumulating the coin they stake?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: easily possible I think.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Although starting to check vast numbers of address/pubkey at some point you will slow down things a bit much. I guess unless we try it we cant know though.

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Im not sure how itd be coded, but could you just hardcode pubkeys in and allow only those addresses to stake. Meaning if any random person tried to stake, it would check against the pubkeys in the hardcode and either allow, or not

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yes made something exactly like this for the streamer chain, all that is needed is a loop isntead of checking a single key.
